item.title: A whale deposited 1 million USDC into Hyperliquid and went long on ETH, BTC, and PUMP.
item.description: On August 19th, as monitored by Onchain Lens, a whale deposited 1 million USDC into Hyperliquid (with a total of $1.35 million). Subsequently, it opened long positions: ETH with a 25x leverage, BTC with a 40x leverage, and PUMP with a 5x leverage.

item.title: Analyst: Bitcoin May Remain Range-Bound, Market Focuses on Powell's Speech This Friday
item.description: On August 19th, CryptoQuant analyst Axel Adler Jr. posted and stated, "The sentiment index in the futures market has dropped below the neutral zone to 36%. From August 11th to 14th, as the Bitcoin price surged to $123,000, this index briefly rose to 70%. Currently, the Bitcoin price is maintaining at $115,000, and the momentum of the sentiment index is decreasing: in the index composition, sellers dominate in the short term (net traders and volume difference are negative), while open interest contracts remain neutral. This indicates that the market has transitioned from a state of euphoric sentiment at the peak to a range-bound phase."This state implies that when the index is still below 45-50%, a rebound may trigger selling pressure, and the price is likely to fluctuate in a narrow range. If the index continues to be lackluster during a weak rebound, it may increase the testing of $112,000. The key this week is Powell's speech at the Jackson Hole summit on Friday (economic outlook a

item.title: Binance Launchpool will no longer support USDC purchase and BFUSD redemption
item.description: August 19th. According to official information, starting from 16:00 on August 25th, 2025 (in UTC+8 time zone), Binance Savings will no longer be able to support the purchase and redemption of BFUSD with USDC. Users can continue to use USDT for the purchase and redemption of BFUSD.

item.title: The US Ethereum Spot ETF currently holds over 5% of the ETH supply
item.description: On August 19th, as reported by The Block, on-chain data indicates that the US Ether ETF holds 6.3 million ETH (approximately $26.7 billion) in on-chain assets, which accounts for nearly 5.1% of the current total supply of Ethereum.

item.title: LookOnChain: Binance Alpha Launches BAS
item.description: On August 19, Binance Alpha initiated BAS.

item.title: If Ethereum drops below $4100, the cumulative long liquidation on major CEXs will reach $1.392 billion.
item.description: On August 19th, based on Coinglass data, if Ethereum drops below $4100, the cumulative liquidation strength of mainstream CEXs will reach $1.392 billion.Conversely, if Ethereum rises above $4400, the cumulative short liquidation strength of mainstream CEXs will reach $1.564 billion.BlockBeats Note: The liquidation chart does not display the exact number of contracts to be liquidated or the exact value of contracts to be liquidated. The bars on the liquidation chart actually represent the significance of each liquidation cluster in relation to adjacent liquidation clusters, that is, the strength.Therefore, the liquidation chart shows the extent to which the target price will be influenced when it reaches a certain level. A higher "liquidation bar" indicates that the price will have a more intense response due to the surge in liquidity.

item.title: Bitcoin Whale has accumulated an additional 20,061 BTC since last week's pullback.
item.description: On August 19th, as per Cointelegraph, wallets holding between 10 and 10,000 bitcoins have witnessed an additional accumulation of 20,061 coins since the pullback of last week. This has led to their total holdings reaching 225,320 bitcoins since March.

item.title: Circle Coin Innovation Technology, HashKey Group, Beosin, and SlowMist jointly launched the Digital Asset Anti-Money Laundering Professional Committee
item.description: On August 19th, Yuan Coin Innovation Technology, HashKey Group, Beosin, and SlowMist jointly declared the establishment of the Digital Asset Anti-Money Laundering Professional Committee (DAAMC). This committee was formed with the support of the Hong Kong Virtual Asset Industry Association (HKVAIA). It is an industry-leading non-profit organization committed to promoting cooperation among regulated financial institutions to formulate and promote first-class Anti-Money Laundering and Combating the Financing of Terrorism (AML/CFT) standards and practices. The aim is to drive the compliant issuance of stablecoins in Hong Kong and enhance the financial integrity within the digital asset ecosystem.

item.title: Odin.fun Co-founder: Hacked Funds Frozen, Audit and Remediation in Progress
item.description: August 19th, for Odin.fun co-founder Bob Bodily, he stated that certain funds in CEX and tokens have been frozen. Currently, they are collaborating with the authorities to investigate the individuals involved and make efforts to recover the assets. The platform is nearing the completion of audit fixes. Once the audit party gives confirmation, a public report will be released. Before resuming trading, the platform will ensure that user funds are 1:1 fully covered. The team is also dealing with the impact caused by the attacker, removing abnormal transactions and preserving legitimate user transactions. Bob indicated that the resumption of trading will depend on the confirmation of funds, the completion of audits, and the readiness of platform cleanup on three fronts. The timeline has not been determined yet, but the progress is good.

item.title: Crypto Fear & Greed Index Drops to 56, Market Still in 'Greed' Sentiment
item.description: On August 19th, according to Alternative Data, the Crypto Fear and Greed Index for today dropped to 56 (yesterday it was 60), with a weekly average of 68, suggesting that the market still maintains a "greedy" sentiment.Note: The Fear and Greed Index has a threshold ranging from 0 to 100 and encompasses the following indicators: Volatility (25%) + Market Volume (25%) + Social Media Hype (15%) + Market Surveys (15%) + Bitcoin's Dominance (10%) + Google Trends Analysis (10%).
